page.title: 10WORK IN THE CLUNTON AREA
page.content: The bulk of the people living within the Clunton area, either are retired or in farming. For the remainder work means travelling to larger centres. One husband and wife travel to Wolverhampton every day, another works abroad leaving his family for long periods and another comes home at weekends only. For those with work nearer to home Shrewsbury (30 miles) is not considered too far to travel. Ludlow, Craven Arms, Knighton and Bishop's Castle offer openings to a few. Within Clunton village there is a small packaging factory called Cook's Choice which packs herbs and spices for sale nationwide. The firm began trading in 1975 in a village near Welshpool Powys. They moved in 1978 to Clunton where they employ 10 local women and is a thriving industry.
